result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C. Bradbury was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph C. Bradbury is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph C. Bradbury was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C. Bradbury

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

09:30 AM 
Defendant, Joseph C. Bradbury, appeared pro se.
Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.
  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Def. is not eligible for pub def. and wants to accept State's offer.
Court recessed so def. could fill out plea form.
10:20 am-Back on record:
Defendant waives counsel entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Battery; found guilty by the court.
Ct 2 was dismissed outright on State's motion.
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions;
4 days sentence credit if revoked.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Appeal rights given.

09:16 AM
Defendant, Joseph C. Bradbury, appeared.
Attorney Jennifer A. Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Def. is not eligible to pub. def. and will represent himself.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Jamie E L - 3rd party contact for pick up/drop off and infrmation on children.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Jamie L  residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

218PM   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 02:10 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 09:15 am. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  DE not eligible for SPD.
